Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the database migration, including source and target database types, data volume, downtime tolerance, and security needs.
Verify compatibility between the source database and the target Azure database. Identify any schema or feature differences that need to be addressed.
Create an instance of Azure Database Migration Service in the Azure portal, ensuring proper configuration for the migration scenario.
Set up networking and security configurations, including Virtual Network (VNet) integration, firewall rules, and access controls to ensure secure communication between source and target databases.
Run a pre-migration assessment using Azure tools to identify potential issues, such as schema incompatibilities or unsupported features.
Develop a strategy for data synchronization during the migration process to minimize downtime and ensure data consistency.
Migrate the database schema from the source to the target database using Azure tools or manual processes as required.
Transfer data from the source database to the target Azure database using Azure Database Migration Service. Monitor the process for errors or interruptions.
Verify the integrity and completeness of the migrated data. Perform tests to ensure the target database is functioning as expected.
Apply security best practices to the target database, such as enabling encryption, configuring firewalls, and setting up access controls.
Set up monitoring tools to track the performance of the migrated database. Optimize configurations to ensure efficient operation.
Create detailed documentation of the migration process, including configurations, challenges, and resolutions. Share this with the operations team for future reference.
Train the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the migrated database. Include best practices for maintenance and security.
Schedule regular audits to ensure the database remains secure, compliant, and optimized for performance.
